ygData.subject: Re: Cut and Paste form EQ'Lizer
ygData.msgSnippet: Ok here is the prime example of how we warriors suck. (Not that i enjoy calling myself names or anything) With my warrior and some friends i attempted to solo
ygData.messageBody:
Ok here is the prime example of how we warriors suck. (Not that i enjoy
calling myself names or anything)

With my warrior and some friends i attempted to solo a blue sand giant. I
had a cleric of the same level with me and a magician as well ( all level
37.) SO i begin the fight and it starts going bad right away. There i am
hitting him and seeing his Hp bar drain waaaay slow. I figure i can stand
here and take his punishment maybe 1 minute longer. So my friends step in
and heal me up and we take it together quite easily.

Ok Then the cleric acts all tough and decides he wants some 1 on 1 action
with a giant for kicks. Ok we say. I stand back with the magician as the
cleric proceeds to root / wrath and hit the giant to death. He finished off
the battle with about 1/8th life left mind you but he did kill the damn
thing.

There you have it. A cleric at level 37 takes on the giant, a warrior of
same level WITH buffs cannot. Not much else can be said. Oh sure i know its
like comparing apples and oranges but hell, doesnt it kinda make you mad.
Sure he's got spells but we are WARRIORS the so called masters of combat and
defense.

I think that troll warrior had it right. This is why ive pretty much put my
warrior on the shelf and been playing with a cleric char. Get this. At level
16 with my warrior i would never ever partied solo. never. with my cleric i
ususally play solo. I get levels faster, cause i can take creatures that con
even to me with my cleric.

Well thats my 2 cents, take it or leave it but im pretty sure that we all
agree that warriors need something from verant to distinguish us from the
rest of the classes.

Lothaniel T'Kazz
Mighty Tier'dal Warrior of the 37th Rank.

> ----------
> From: James Wofford[SMTP:James.Wofford@...]
> Reply To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
> Sent: Thursday, June 10, 1999 2:27 PM
> To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
> Subject: Re: [warriors_eq] Cut and Paste form EQ'Lizer
>
> I am not actually board with my character, just tired of waiting for the
> goodies to come when they are actually no where to be found. They will
> never get to us, and we are outweighed even in a group setting by other
> melee classes.
>
> I am not so concerned about the magic using/healing/gating part of this as
> I am the fact that the masters of physical combat (warriors) are anything
> but that. Healing never has been IMO a part of what a warrior can do.
> But a warrior is supposed to be the master or armed combat. When we cap
> out at skill level 200 and others can go beyond that as well as do more
> damage than us warrior, something is definitely wrong. I think we should
> start a pettition to verant to try to even things out a bit more. The
> suggestions in this post on EQ`Lizer for modifying the Warrior class are
> well thought and not too much to ask.
>
> If anyone else is at all interested in starting a pettition, I will get
> things going. Just let me know and I can get things rolling on it....
> Even if you dont respond to me on this, I will get things going anyways.
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Elena Glenn [ mailto:braveheart@...]
> Sent: Thursday, June 10, 1999 11:27 AM
> To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
> Subject: [warriors_eq] Cut and Paste form EQ'Lizer
>
>
> James....I also am getting a little bored with my level 19 Barbarian
> Warrior. One of the reasons, I guess, that I started the Bard. I do
> think that Verant has overlooked us slightly. When I played Realm, the
> warrior on there could buy mana and cast spells. Agreed, they didn't work
> as well as the mages did, but we still could have the basics. I would
> like to see Verant come up with another plan. Perhaps some sort of magic
> skill, so at the very least, we could gate and cast healing on ourselves.
>
>
> Leri
>
>
